tax_optimization_strategies.details: Contribute to superannuation to take advantage of tax concessions. Consider salary sacrificing up to the concessional cap ($27,500 for the 2023 financial year) to reduce taxable income.
Check eligibility for tax offsets such as the Low and Middle Income Tax Offset (LMITO) and the Seniors and Pensioners Tax Offset (SAPTO).
If one partner has a lower income, consider income splitting strategies, such as transferring income-generating assets to the lower-income partner to reduce overall tax liability.
If they own investment properties, consider negative gearing to offset rental losses against their taxable income.
Ensure all work-related expenses are claimed, including home office expenses, travel, and professional development costs.
Consider investing in tax-effective vehicles such as managed funds or exchange-traded funds (ETFs) that may provide capital gains tax discounts.
Hold investments for more than 12 months to qualify for a 50% discount on capital gains tax.
Establish a family trust to distribute income among beneficiaries in lower tax brackets, thus reducing overall tax liability.
Prepay certain expenses (e.g., insurance, subscriptions) before the end of the financial year to bring forward deductions.
Evaluate the structure of investments (e.g., personal vs. company vs. trust) to determine the most tax-efficient option.
